Posts.Title: swollen hands and achey body mamakaren linda05

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 11:04AM mamakaren wrote: Hi Deanna, I just got out of my appt with onc and everything was good thank God! My heart EF went back to normal and they want me to start the Herceptin  tomorrow. Blood work was great also! The wrist and hand pain they say that it could be arthritis so they will do some blood work to find out other that they said take Tylenol. Penny, Don't get discouraged this is temporary, this is the way i see it. The amount of time it takes to cure our bodies that's probably the amount of time it's gonna take to heal our bodies. So take it easy (easier said than done) just trying to cheer you up!  I hope you find comfort. As for me I'm gonna stay on the once a week treatment then they will check me every two months. As i left the office i was thinking that i want to get checked every month just for my piece of mind. Lots Of Love Bald Hotties!! Karen
Posts.Title: swollen hands and achey body mamakaren linda05

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2009 05:03PM mamakaren wrote: Hey Penny, I also have the same pain and swelling and haven't been wearing my wedding ring either. they told me also that it has nothing to do with Herceptin but i all started @ 2 weeks before my last radiation, i was also taking Herceptin with rads. So i don't know which one did it, they say that rads stay in your body for a while after your done. I don't know if thats true don't know much about it. My rads doc said that it has nothing to do with rads because they only treat the breast so who knows I have my rads doc blaming my oncologist.  So how are you doing besides the hand nonsense??
Posts.Title: swollen hands and achey body mamakaren linda05

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2008 08:17AM mamakaren wrote: Hi daisyhope, This is my first time on this site. I was diagnosed with IDC in january of this year. I wish i could give you answers to your questions but the truth is that i don't even know much about my cancer, when the doctors explain things to me i's like i'm in another world and can't hear anything that they say. It's been sometime since my lumpectomy actually i had two lumpectomies also currently on chemo a total of eight. I also am desperate to talk to someone about what i'm going through, I still have'nt come to terms with my cancer but i think that we can help eachother out. I'm starting to learn morer about my diagnoses even though i get this sick feeling in my stomach everytime i try to read my pathology report or even talk about what's wrong with me. Just know that i'm praying for you and here for you. All i can say is that i have got this far by clinging to my faith.
Posts.Title: Nottingham grade: III of III - Mottingham score: 9 of 9 daisyhope Denise2730

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2008 04:27PM mamakaren wrote: Starr, I finished chemo (taxatere) 7 weeks ago and I feel your pain. I have noticed since last friday my legs didn't hurt like they had been hurting. They still feel sore a little when I get up from sitting down but nothing like before it was very painful. I would take a hot bath and then massage my legs with alcohol and it would help me alot. Hope this helps you. Lots of Love    Karen.

Posts.Content: mamakaren wrote: I finished toxatere more than a week ago and I'm wondering if anyone has had the same problem and if it goes away within time or could it be permanent? Posts.Title: Stinging hot flashes anyone? Sheilaps mamakaren

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2008 08:53AM mamakaren wrote: Deanna, Hello hope you had a great Christmas. All I can say is that we all have been blessed to be alive here with our loved ones. Yes I was on Taxotere but now i'm not taking anything since the Herceptin. It's been almost 2 weeks since i've been off Radiation also. To think of it all this started towards the last 2 weeks of Radiation, the last one was on Dec 16th. My bones have never hurt like this not even when I was chemo. Monday I go to my Onc appt to see what the heck is gonna happen with that Herceptin. I'm glad that you didn't have arthritis I hope I don't. I'm gonna take vitamins and B6. I want to take so many things but i'm afraid to. My onc said I have to watch what i take and make sure that they don't have hormones in it. Due to the fact that I'm HER2+ so that really freaked me out. Hope you have a blessed Holiday! Lots Of Love, Karen
